results.title: Inventory. Part 2
results.creator_credit: Timothy Swartz, Frank Wilson, Penn State, WPSX-TV and Instructional Media
results.brief_description:
Episode number 16 of Series “Principles of accounting”.
Part two of inventory accounting, deals with the difference between the cost of inventory and the value of inventory. Cost is a fixed amount but value can change according to physical condition, market changes in demand and obsolescence. This program details ways of estimating this value for accounting purposes and how inventory records can be adjusted to accommodate fluctuations in value.

results.title: Compound interest
results.creator_credit: Timothy Swartz, Frank Wilson, Instructional Media, Penn State and WPSX-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode number 14 of Series “Principles of accounting”.
Thomas Casey demonstrates how compound interest increases the time value of money. Present value and future value are explained, and how to compute simple and compound interest, which may involve the use of specially designed tables. The program concludes by showing how interest rates can be stated and how to calculate investment for the future.

results.title: Collected Cartoons of the Moment by Harry Julius [NFSA Compilation]
results.brief_description: Harry Julius was employed to produce sketches supporting the conscription drive in Australia for wartime editions of the Australasian Gazette newsreel. He was the first artist in Australia to animate cartoons for films. He successfully used caricature and satire to comment on the social, political and economic impact of World War One – from the Allies point of view. Julius’s drawn animation regularly includes the appearance of animals representing the major war countries including: a battered fez-capped turkey (Turkey); a large aggressive eagle (the United States); and a Union Jack-covered bulldog or lion (the United Kingdom).
results.title_for_label: Collected Cartoons of the Moment by Harry Julius [NFSA Compilation]

results.title: Colette
results.brief_description:
“One never watches enough”. A chronological evocation of the life and work of Gabrielle Sidonie Colette, theatrical artist, writer and journalist.The documentary evokes her early writings (signed by her husband), her fascination for the complexities of love and relationships, as well as her enduring passion for cats.

Credits: Director, Edouard Berne ; photography, Dominique Chapuis ; music, Monique Rollin.
Cast: Hugette Lengagne [narration only].

results.title: Cole Porter's Les girls [Widescreen]
results.brief_description: Members of the now defunct “Barry Nichols and Les Girls” musical act (Gene Kelly, Kay Kendall, Mitzi Gaynor) are re-united under inauspicious circumstances. It appears that one performer, Lady Wren, has published a no holds barred memoir, highlighting her years, and the romantic escapades within the cabaret group. A libel suit is brought forward by another member of the troupe, suing for defamation of character. This leads to a courtroom setting in which they attempt to reach the truth behind the story. Through flashback inspired by Sybil’s memoirs, stories of suicide, unrequited love, and love spurned are recounted in Rashomon like style to reveal vastly different accounts in this witty, delightful musical. Music and lyrics by Cole Porter. (Awards: Academy award for Best Costume Design, Orry-Kelly).

results.title: Rules and tools
results.creator_credit: Timothy Swartz, Frank Wilson, Pennsylvania State University and WPSX-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Principles of accounting”.
This program focuses on the basic “rules” of accounting - Debits/ Credits and the basic “tools” of accounting - Journals/Ledgers. It is explained and demonstrated by using the basic accounting equation “assets = liabilities + owner’s equity” how to determine which accounts are involved and then to analyse and record transactions using the Debit/ Credit (or double entry) rule. Journals and Ledgers are the tools for recording transactions, with Journals showing a chronological listing and Ledgers maintaining a running total of transactions in each account. Using the rules and tools of accounting it is shown how to finally produce a Balance Sheet.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Timothy Swartz, Frank Wilson, Pennsylvania State University and WPSX-TV

results.title: Cold-rodders
results.creator_credit: Claude Larue, Marc Beaudet and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: An amusing view of the machine that has taken the country by winter storm: the snowmobile, revving, raring, ready to go. What the motorboat was to the summer lake, this motorized sled now is to the snow-covered fields. This film shows it all - the pull of this sit-down sport, the eagerness of the trade to keep it booming, the daring rivalry of the racing crowd, and the bemused pleasure of the family outing.

results.title: Coerver coaching method. Vol. 1
results.brief_description: Wiel Coerver, renowned Dutch soccer champion teaches a comprehensive range of soccer skills. Volume 1 of this three-part collection includes the following playing techniques: ball feeling, fast footwork, shielding and changing direction.
